sub_title: PwC Global Tax Policy | Investor-State Tax Related Dispute Settlements| International Tax Services
summary:
I render advice, second and expert opinions to clients and to other advisors on corporate income tax, EU and tax and investment treaty matters. Academically, you can read around 100 publications of mine, including four monographs. I also teach on international tax law, investment tax related disputes and AI and tax law domestically and abroad at various universities and institutions. 

I have completed a full time post-doctoral research fellowship at the Singapore Management University (2017-2018) and a full time PhD research program at the Department of Public and International Law at the University of Oslo (2012-2016). As a member of the International Fiscal Association, the International Association of Artificial Intelligence and Law, and The European Federation for Investment Law and Arbitration, I expand an ever growing network of the top tax law, investment law and artificial intelligence experts around the world. My past membership in the international research project entitled “Sustainable Tax Governance in Developing Countries through Global Tax Transparency”, financed by the Research Council of Norway, allowed me, in turn, to obtain an experience in cooperative teamwork with prominent tax law experts from 7 universities across three continents and two hemispheres.

I speak English, Norwegian, Russian and Polish, my native language. I also have some knowledge of Portuguese.

Specialties: international and comparative tax law, ISDS tax related cases, artificial intelligence and law.

awards.title: IFA President YIN Scientific Award (2016)
awards.description: The 2016 IFA President YIN Scientific Award for the publication of article “The Need to Avoid Double Economic Taxation Triggered by CFC Rules under Tax Treaties, and the Way to Achieve it” at the Intertax 2015, No. 12

awards.title: "Competent Communicator (CC) Award" for exceptional achievements in the Toastmasters International's Competent Communication Program
awards.description: I received the "Competent Communicator (CC) Award" for exceptional achievements in the Toastmasters International's Competent Communication Program. Among 10 speeches prepared in advance and delivered by me, I was chosen to be the Best Speaker 5 times. 9 times the audience decided to give me the pleasure to be the Best Spontaneous Speaker (Best Table Topics) with my  in promptu speeches. And one time I became the Best Evaluator (yes, I was delivering speeches more than evaluating;-). Looking forward to grow and enjoy life!

awards.title: Certification of Completion of the Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) training course
awards.description:
I received the Certification of Completion of the Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) training course!.
The course is modelled on the program founded by Jon Kabat-Zinn at the University of Massachusetts Medical School. During the last eight weeks, I have been learning to be kinder to myself, both in meditation and in daily life, and discovering just how interconnected we are with everything around us. As a result, the critical part of myself, which is “slowly melting away”, tells me that the practices and my learning are deep and inside-out, rather than superficial and top-down. I am continuing meditation. And I will, endlessly:-) I strongly recommend to complete this course, by everyone."The moment one gives close attention to anything, even a blade of grass, it becomes a mysterious, awesome, indescribably magnificent world in itself."
- Henry Miller -
awards.issuer: Dave Potter, a certified Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction instructor who received his training through University of Massachusetts Medical School where Jon Kabat-Zinn founded the Center for Mindfulness

company.name: Young European Federation for Investment Law and Arbitration (EFILA)

profile_positions.company: Young European Federation for Investment Law and Arbitration (EFILA)
profile_positions.description:
The EU was created to achieve the strengthening of economies of its Members States and to contribute to the protection of its citizens. The economic and political stability and development of the EU and its Member States depends to a large extent on offering a stable and foreseeable legal framework for domestic and foreign investors.

In addition, access to an efficient and effective dispute settlement system is an important and integral element of the Rule of Law within and outside of the EU and its Member States.

EFILA complements these endeavours by providing as a Brussels-based think-tank a platform for a fact- and merit-based discussion on pertaining to all relevant issues associated with the EU’s investment law and arbitration policy.

To this end, EFILA regularly organizes events such as the Annual Conference and the Annual Lecture.

Together with the Queen Mary University of London, EFILA publishes the European Investment Law and Arbitration Review. The first legal journal that is exclusively dedicated to the EU’s investment law and policy agenda.

EFILA also publishes papers on relevant topics of European investment law and policy and participates in public consultations organized by the EU, OECD, ICSID etc.

EFILA also actively participates as an Observer in the UNCITRAL WG III on ISDS reforms.

profile_positions.description: As a Senior Research Fellow at the Amsterdam Centre of Tax law (The ACTL) of the University of Amsterdam (UvA), I specialize in business taxation, anti-BEPS rules, and technology solutions in the domain of tax law. My current work cover the various exciting areas of direct taxation and a hybrid domain of an application of technology to tax law.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Fellow

profile_positions.title: Deputy Director: Strategic Tax Advice | Dispute Resolution
Second Opinion Advisor in International Tax Issues

profile_positions.description:
NOTABLE ACTIVITIES
•	Responsible for supervising and drafting legally binding general interpreation and clarifications to the Polish Investment Zone (PSI) regime introduced to the Polish law in May 2018
•	Responsible for supervising and drafting legally binding clarifications to the IP Box regime introduced to the Polish tax law as of 1 January 2019
•	Responsible for drafting the amendments to the Polish CFC rules with a legally binding force from 1 January 2019 with an emphasis to foreign trusts and foundations
•	Acting as the Competent Authority for the Ministry of Finance in Poland for the purposes of Mutual Agreement Procedures under the double tax treaties ratified by Poland
